channel.title: Morning Defense
channel.description: From the SitRoom to the E-Ring, the inside scoop on defense, national security and foreign policy.

item.title: Antifa, drones, foreigner vetting on the admin’s mind
item.description: Immigration dominated today’s House Homeland Security Committee hearing on threats to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: By Eric Bazail-Eimil, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Eric Bazail-Eimil, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: How a new Russia-China-US network could work
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Norway deploys ‘thirst trap’ diplomacy
item.description: With President Donald Trump describing Europe’s leaders as “weak” and the National Security Strategy mourning Europe’s “lack of self-confidence,” the continent’s diplomats vying for attention and respect in Washington have their work cut out for them.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: What you missed in the NDAA
item.description: The National Defense Authorization Act is steaming toward passage. But buried within the massive 3,000 page document, there are several nuggets you might have missed.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Phelim Kine
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Phelim Kine

item.title: ‘Trump Corollary’ reboots US foreign policy
item.description: The U.S. National Security Strategy that just dropped puts the Western Hemisphere at its center, trashes Europe, reassures Taiwan and sends mixed signals on China and India.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow, Phelim Kine and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow, Phelim Kine and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Trump’s red — and pink — lines in the Middle East
item.description: As the Trump administration attempts to hold together the fragile ceasefire in Gaza, Israel has not only continued striking the embattled strip but ramped up operations in both neighboring Lebanon and Syria.
item.dc:creator: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: Afghan visas face cliff in Congress
item.description: As the Trump administration cracks down on immigration from Afghanistan following the shooting of National Guard troops by an Afghan national, Congress isn’t looking eager to use the one bit of leverage it has to keep the door open for foreigners who fought alongside U.S. troops.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: A skeptical Washington watches Witkoff stroll Moscow
item.description: We’re still waiting to hear the outcome of the talks, but special envoy Steve Witkoff’s sixth Moscow visit is likely not the end of the diplomatic back-and-forth.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: White House doubles down as boat strike roils Congress
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Inside the Hill push to keep the pressure on Putin
item.description: Ukraine’s congressional supporters are deploying the limited tools in their arsenal — which mostly consist of rallying support for sanctions bills — to push the White House to get tougher on Russia.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: What’s Trump’s window to strike Venezuela?
item.dc:creator: By Eric Bazail-Eimil, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Phelim Kine
item.dc:contributor: By Eric Bazail-Eimil, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Phelim Kine

item.title: Colombia: DC and Bogota have ‘same goal’
item.description: Tensions between President Donald Trump and Colombian President Gustavo Petro are near boiling, as the two leaders have spent months trading increasingly dire threats.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: US hits China scamwall
item.description: The Trump administration is trying to go after Chinese crime networks that bilk Americans of billions of dollars through online fraud schemes. But the U.S. is running up against Beijing’s unwillingness to play ball.
item.dc:creator: By Phelim Kine, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Phelim Kine, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: NATO’s Hill allies are kicking into gear
item.description: NATO’s defenders on Capitol Hill aren’t planning to let the Trump administration diminish U.S. support for the transatlantic alliance without a fight — even as the Pentagon moves to draw down U.S. troops from Europe’s eastern flank.
item.dc:creator: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing, Connor O'Brien and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing, Connor O'Brien and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: About those Venezuela back channels…
item.description: Tensions between the U.S. and Venezuela are nearing their boiling point. But back-channel communications between Washington and Caracas are largely silent.
item.dc:creator: By Eric Bazail-Eimil, Nahal Toosi, Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Eric Bazail-Eimil, Nahal Toosi, Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Russia sanctions bite before Senate piles on
item.description: Russia is feeling the pinch from President Donald Trump’s latest sanctions, as world energy markets show the new prohibitions on Rosneft and Lukoil are having some effect.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Regional chaos burnishes Brand MBS
item.description: Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin SAalman is set to meet President Donald Trump on Tuesday in a sign of a reputational facelift from Riyadh that goes deep across Washington, including in the halls of Congress.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: War Department catches on in Washington
item.description: In the last two months, President Donald Trump’s rebranding of the Department of Defense — aka the Department of War — has steadily gained ground in Washington and changed the way people talk about the Pentagon.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Pokrovsk’s importance beyond the battlefield
item.description: Losing the eastern Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk won’t necessarily be the death knell for Ukraine’s defense — but it’s likely to be used as a messaging tool by both Moscow and Kyiv as they try to convince the Trump administration to stick with their respective sides.
item.dc:creator: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: Beijing wants more Pentagon convos — but at a price
item.description: The Chinese government says that Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth had the right idea when he called for closer ties between the world’s most powerful militaries.
item.dc:creator: By Phelim Kine, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Phelim Kine, Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: The trouble the shutdown is causing a NATO ally
item.description: According to a State Department cable obtained by your hosts, a senior German official recently pressed a top U.S. diplomat on how long the U.S. shutdown would last, stressing that Berlin is picking up the tab for thousands of people who work for the U.S.
item.dc:creator: By Nahal Toosi, Chris Lunday, Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Nahal Toosi, Chris Lunday, Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Inside al-Sharaa’s full-court Washington press
item.description: A charm offensive is being waged by Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa and his advocates as the new leader met with President Donald Trump today.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Orbán, Trump enter ‘golden age’ — at Ukraine’s expense
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Another roadblock for Afghan refugees
item.description: Lawmakers on both sides of the aisle are pushing for action from the U.S. government to resettle Afghan refugees, whom it had promised to relocate in return for their help during the 20-year U.S. mission in the country.
item.dc:creator: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: Return of the NatSec Dems
item.description: The fact that a former CIA officer and Navy veteran shellacked their Republican opponents in statewide elections Tuesday offers a reminder that national security bona fides are still very marketable to Democratic and independent voters.
item.dc:creator: By Eric Bazail-Eimil, Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Eric Bazail-Eimil, Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Mixed messages from Trump admin on Nigeria
item.description: President Donald Trump’s recent threat to send troops “guns-a-blazing” to Nigeria to stop the persecution of Christians is exposing tensions inside the administration over how to approach both Abuja and West Africa as a whole.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Inside the Pentagon fight with Congress over troops
item.description: The Trump administration’s decision to draw down troops from Romania is escalating the tug-of-war over how much say Congress should have in where the U.S. puts its forces.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: What Congress is, and isn’t, doing on Sudan
item.description: The latest violence in Sudan is triggering calls in Congress for action — with Senate Foreign Relations Chair Jim Risch (R-Idaho) leading a call to designate the Rapid Support Forces paramilitary as a foreign terrorist organization.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing

item.title: Trump’s nuclear Pandora’s box
item.description: President Donald Trump wants to restart nuclear testing. Exactly how escalatory that is depends on what kind of testing he’s talking about.
item.dc:creator: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing, Connor O'Brien, Joe Gould and Daniella Cheslow
item.dc:contributor: By Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing, Connor O'Brien, Joe Gould and Daniella Cheslow

item.title: The Pentagon goes to Wall Street
item.description: Private capital could become further entwined with the U.S. defense establishment.
item.dc:creator: By Daniella Cheslow, Leo Shane III and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
item.dc:contributor: By Daniella Cheslow, Leo Shane III and Giselle Ruhiyyih Ewing
